macro.para:
This macro expands to the contents of tuple.
(3, (a, b, c)) // a, b, c
Note that in C99, the macro is capable of removing the parenthese from a of any size. Thus, the size parameter is ignored.

The primary purpose of this macro is remove the parentheses from a that is the result of a macro invocation. In such a circumstance, use of will not expand the against the without the manual introduction of another scan:
#define A (a, b, c)
((3) A) // a, b, c
This macro aids in this situation by allowing the argument to expand prior to parentheses removal:
(3, A) // a, b, c
